text: Psalm 44
Present Defeat and Past Deliverance

For the \add music\add* director. Of the sons of Korah. A maskil.\f + \fr Ps 44 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
O God, we have heard with our ears;
our ancestors\f + \fr 44:1 \ft Or “fathers” \f* have told us
of work you worked in their days,
in days of old.
You \add with\add* your hand drove out the nations,
but them\f + \fr 44:2 \ft That is, Israel \f* you planted.
You harmed \add the\add* peoples,
but them\f + \fr 44:2 \ft That is, Israel \f* you let spread out.
For not with their sword
did they possess \add the\add* land,
and their arm did not give them victory.
Rather \add it was\add* your right hand and your arm
and the light of your presence,
because you delighted in them.
You are my king, O God.
Command\f + \fr 44:4 \ft Or “who commands,” see LXX \f* victories for Jacob.
By you we push down our enemies;
by your name we tread down those who rise up against us.
For I do not trust my bow,
and my sword cannot give me victory.
Rather you have saved us from our enemies,\f + \fr 44:7 \ft Or “made us victorious over our enemies” \f*
and have humiliated those who hate us.
In God we boast all the day,
and we will give thanks \add to\add* your name forever. \qs Selah\qs*
Surely you have rejected and disgraced us,
and have not gone out with our armies.
You have caused us to pull back from \add the\add* enemy,
and \add so\add* those who hate us have plundered for themselves.
You have given us as sheep \add for\add* food,
and among the nations you have scattered us.
You have sold your people ⸤cheaply⸥,\f + \fr 44:12 \ft Literally “for \fq what is \ft not wealth” \f*
and did not profit by their price.
You have made us a taunt to our neighbors,
a derision and a scorn to those around us.
You have made us a byword among the nations,
a shaking of \add the\add* head among \add the\add* peoples.
⸤All day long⸥\f + \fr 44:15 \ft Literally “All of the day” \f* my disgrace \add is\add* before me,
and the shame of my face covers me,
because of \add the\add* voice of \add the\add* taunter and \add the\add* reviler,
because of \add the\add* enemy and \add the\add* avenger.
All this has befallen us, though we have not forgotten you,
and we have not been false to your covenant.
Our heart has not turned back,
and our steps have \add not\add* turned aside from your way.
But you have crushed us in a place of jackals,
and have covered us with deep shadow.
If we had forgotten the name of our God,
or had spread out our hands \add in prayer\add* to a foreign god,
would not God discover this,
for he knows \add the\add* secrets of \add the\add* heart?
Rather, on account of you we are killed ⸤all day long⸥;\f + \fr 44:22 \ft Literally “all of the day” \f*
we are accounted as sheep for slaughter.
Wake up! Why do you sleep, O Lord?
Awake! Do not reject forever.
Why do you hide your face?
\add Have\add* you forgotten our misery and our oppression?
For our soul is bowed down to the dust.
Our ⸤body⸥\f + \fr 44:25 \ft Literally “belly” \f* clings to the ground.
Rise up! \add Be a\add* help for us,
and redeem us for the sake of your loyal love.
